Description: Equestrian portrait of Napoleon against background of battle of the Pyramids. after 1810 Engraving
Producer name: Print made by: Philippe Joseph Augustin Vallot
Curator's comments: Date of engraving lost at damaged corner.
Associated names: Representation of: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Associated events: Associated Event: Napoleon's campaign in Egypt 1798 - 1799
Acquisition name: Purchased from: David Alexander Edward Lindsay, 27th Earl of Crawford and 10th Earl of Balcarres (L.1685c)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: James Ludovic Lindsay, 26th Earl of Crawford
Acquisition notes: The BM bought 45 lots at the 1925 sale of the Lindsay library collection of French revolutionary and Napoleonic era prints through Agnew's for a total of £92 17s (1925,0615.131 to 466). The collection had been formed by the vendor's father, the 26th Earl. The BM acquired many other prints from the same collection at other times.
